getValue

Class ReligionValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • getValue.ReligionValue

  • public class ReligionValue
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains getters and setters allowing the calling method to obtain stats on the particular religion being requested.
    Author:
    Nicholas Ingalls

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReligionValue(java.lang.String data, java.lang.String religion)
      Constructs a new ReligionValue object

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDesc()
      Returns the religion's descriptions
      java.lang.String[] getLevelList()
      Returns the levels within a religion
      java.lang.String[] getRequiredClass()
      Returns a String[] containing the class requirements for a religion If there are no class requirements, the first element of the String[] will equal "none"
      java.lang.String[] getRequiredRace()
      Returns a String[] containing the race requirements for a religion If there are no race requirements, the first element of the String[] will equal "none"
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Returns the religion's full name
      void setDesc(java.lang.String desc)
      Sets the religion's description
      void setLevelList(java.lang.String[] levelList)
      Sets the levels within a religion
      void setRequiredClass(java.lang.String[] requiredClass)
      Sets the class requirements for a religion If there are no class requirements, the paramater should be a single element array with the first element equaling "none"
      void setRequiredRace(java.lang.String[] requiredRace)
      Sets the race requirements for a religion If there are no race requirements, the parameter should be a single element array with the first element equaling "none"
      void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Sets the religion's full name

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getRequiredClass

        public java.lang.String[] getRequiredClass()
        Returns a String[] containing the class requirements for a religion If there are no class requirements, the first element of the String[] will equal "none"
        Returns:
        A String[] containing the class requirements

      • setRequiredClass

        public void setRequiredClass(java.lang.String[] requiredClass)
        Sets the class requirements for a religion If there are no class requirements, the paramater should be a single element array with the first element equaling "none"
        Parameters:
        requiredClass - A String[] containing the names of the levels

      • getRequiredRace

        public java.lang.String[] getRequiredRace()
        Returns a String[] containing the race requirements for a religion If there are no race requirements, the first element of the String[] will equal "none"
        Returns:
        A String[] containing the race requirements

      • setRequiredRace

        public void setRequiredRace(java.lang.String[] requiredRace)
        Sets the race requirements for a religion If there are no race requirements, the parameter should be a single element array with the first element equaling "none"
        Parameters:
        requiredRace - A String[] containing the race requirements
